text: その前にちょっちやってみたいことがあるの
translation: Before that, there's something I'd like to try.
grammar: ~てみたい expresses wanting to try something; の at the end makes it explanatory/feminine

text: 目標のレンジ外 長長距離からの直接射撃かね / そうです 目標のATフィールドを中はせず / 高エネルギー収束帯による一点突破しか方法はありません / マギはどう言ってる
translation: Direct fire from outside the target's range, from long distance? / That's right. Without neutralizing the target's AT Field / our only method is a single-point breakthrough with a high-energy convergence beam. / What does MAGI say?
grammar: ~による indicates means/method; しか~ない means 'only/nothing but'

text: スーパーコンピューター マギによる回答は / 賛成に条件付き賛成が1でした
translation: The supercomputer MAGI's response was / one approval and one conditional approval.
grammar: ~による indicates the source/agent; でした is polite past tense of だ

text: 賞賛は8.7%か / 最も高い数値です
translation: Success rate is 8.7%? / That's the highest number we have.

vocabulary.meaning: praise, admiration (here likely 成算 'probability of success')

grammar: か at the end indicates a question; です is polite copula

text: 反対する理由はない / やりたまえ カツラギ1 / はい
translation: There's no reason to oppose it. / Do it, Katsuragi. / Yes sir.

vocabulary.meaning: do it (command form with たまえ)

grammar: ~する理由はない means 'no reason to do'; たまえ is a commanding but somewhat polite imperative

text: しかしまた無茶な作戦を立てたものね / 桂木作戦部長さん / 無茶とはまた失礼ね
translation: You've come up with quite a reckless plan again / Operations Director Katsuragi. / How rude to call it reckless.
grammar: ~たものね expresses reflection/admiration; とは emphasizes the preceding word

text: 残り9時間以内で実現可能 / おまけに最も確実なものよ / これがね
translation: It's achievable within the remaining 9 hours / and what's more, it's the most reliable option. / This one is.
grammar: ~以内 means 'within'; の at the end nominalizes the phrase

text: うちのポジトロンライフルじゃそんな大出力に耐えられないわよ / どうすんの / 決まってるでしょ / 借りるのよ / 借りるって / まさか
translation: Our positron rifle can't withstand that kind of high output. / So what will we do? / It's obvious, isn't it? / We'll borrow one. / Borrow? / Don't tell me...
grammar: じゃ is casual for では; ~られない is potential negative form; のよ is feminine explanatory

text: そう 戦時券のプロトタイプ
translation: That's right. The Strategic Self-Defense Force's prototype.
grammar: そう affirms the previous statement

text: 以上の理由により この実装溶電子法は / 本日15時より 特務機関NERVが挑発いたします / かといって しかしそんな無茶な
translation: For the above reasons, this experimental positron cannon / will be requisitioned by Special Agency NERV starting at 15:00 today. / That said... but that's so unreasonable!
grammar: ~により indicates reason/cause; いたします is humble form of します

text: 可能な限り 原型をとどめて返却するよう努めますので
translation: We will make every effort to return it in its original condition as much as possible.
grammar: ~をとどめて means 'keeping/retaining'; ~よう努める means 'to try to/make effort to'

text: では ご協力 感謝いたします / いいわよ / レイ 持っていって
translation: Well then, thank you for your cooperation. / Fine. / Rei, take it with you.
grammar: いたします is humble form; ~ていって is te-form of ~ていく (action moving away)

text: 精密機械だからそーっとね
translation: It's precision equipment, so be gentle with it.
grammar: ~から indicates reason; ね at the end is a softening particle

text: しかしATフィールドをも貫くエネルギー算出量は
translation: However, the calculated energy output to penetrate even the AT Field is...
grammar: をも adds emphasis 'even'; は marks the topic

text: 最低1億8000万キロワット / それだけの大電力をどこから集めてくるんですか
translation: A minimum of 180 million kilowatts. / Where are we going to gather that much electrical power from?
grammar: それだけの means 'that much'; ~てくる indicates bringing/gathering toward speaker

text: 決まってるじゃない / 日本中よ
translation: It's obvious, isn't it? / From all over Japan.
grammar: ~じゃない at the end seeks agreement (isn't it?); よ is assertive particle

text: 番組の途中ですが / ここで臨時ニュースをお伝えいたします
translation: We interrupt this program / to bring you breaking news.
grammar: ~ですが indicates 'but'; お~いたします is humble honorific form

text: 本日午後11時30分より明日未明にかけて全国で大規模な停電があります
translation: Starting today at 11:30 PM through early tomorrow morning, there will be large-scale power outages nationwide.
grammar: ~より indicates starting point; ~にかけて means 'extending to/through'

text: 皆様のご協力をよろしくお願いいたします / 繰り返しお伝えいたします
translation: We ask for your cooperation. / We repeat...
grammar: よろしくお願いいたします is a humble polite request phrase

text: 本日午後11時30分より明日未明にかけて全国で大規模な停電があります
translation: Starting today at 11:30 PM through early tomorrow morning, there will be large-scale power outages nationwide.
grammar: Same structure as segment 44; repetition of the announcement

text: 皆様のご協力をよろしくお願いいたします
translation: We ask for your cooperation.
grammar: Polite humble request form with ご~を~お願いいたします

text: 敵シールド第7走行版を突破 / エネルギーシステムの見通しは? / 現在予定より3.2%遅れていますが / 本日23時10分には何とかできます / ポジトロンライフルはどう?
translation: Enemy drill has broken through armor plate 7. / What's the outlook for the energy system? / Currently we're 3.2% behind schedule, but / we can manage by 23:10 today. / How's the positron rifle?
grammar: ~ていますが indicates continuing state with 'but'; には marks time point

text: 技術開発部第3課の維持にかけても / あと3時間で形にしてみせますよ / 防御手段は?
translation: On the pride of Technical Development Section 3, / we'll make it work in 3 hours. / What about defensive measures?
grammar: ~にかけても means 'even if it means staking on'; ~てみせる shows determination 'I'll show you'

text: それはもう盾で防ぐしかないわね / これが盾ですか?
translation: Well, we have no choice but to defend with a shield. / This is the shield?
grammar: ~しかない means 'no choice but to'; わね is feminine confirmatory ending

text: そう、SSTOのお下がり / 見た目はひどくとも / もともと底部は超電池コーディングされている機種だし
translation: Right, a hand-me-down from the SSTO. / Even though it looks terrible, / the heat shielding was originally super-alloy coated.
grammar: ~とも means 'even though'; ~している indicates current state; だし gives reason

text: あの砲撃にも17秒は持つわ / 2課の保証書付きよ / 結構 / 狙撃地点は? / 目標との距離、地形、手頃な変電設備も考えるとやはりここです
translation: It'll hold for 17 seconds against that bombardment. / With Section 2's guarantee. / Good. / The sniping position? / Considering the distance to target, terrain, and convenient transformer facilities, it has to be here.
grammar: ~にも indicates 'even against'; ~を考えると means 'when considering'; やはり means 'as expected/after all'

text: 確かにいけるわ / ね / 狙撃地点は双子山山頂
translation: This will definitely work. / Right. / The sniping point is the summit of Mt. Futago.
grammar: いける is potential form used colloquially to mean 'it'll work'; わ/ね are feminine particles
